alert.note: Alert for Rawlins (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 7:44PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Rawlins and southwestern Hitchcock Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 743 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Stratton, or 15 miles southwest of Trenton, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Rawlins and southwestern Hitchcock Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
